definition: to get on or into (a bus, train, car etc)
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: Pei pull the nan ning get in the car, act of parliament said pei to nan ning did not feel hate.
sentences.chinese: 沛拉着楠寧上車，帕萊說沛對楠寧沒有恨的感覺。

sentences.english: A man boarded the bus and his body was full of perspiration.
sentences.chinese: 一個渾身是汗的男人上車了。

sentences.english: Get many empty seat, everyone orderly and sit down.
sentences.chinese: 上車後還有許多空座位，大家都有序的坐下了。

sentences.english: We had to push the car home as it broke down half way and we couldst know how to repair it.
sentences.chinese: 半路上車拋錨了，我們又無從修理，只得將其推回。

sentences.english: Now she and the others say "good morning" when they get into the car.
sentences.chinese: 現在她和其他孩子上車得的時候都會相互問好。

sentences.english: Get into a car with your partner and drive around the track for a bit.
sentences.chinese: 和你的夥伴一起上車並在跑道上試開一下。

sentences.english: The victim had been on the bus since Edmonton.
sentences.chinese: 受害者是在埃德蒙德上車的。

sentences.english: If you get bingo on the way, tell me in plenty of time.
sentences.chinese: 如果路上車快沒油了，要儘早告訴我。

sentences.english: "All passengers for Regoa take their places, please, " called out the guard.
sentences.chinese: “所有到雷果阿的乘客請上車，”隨車員大聲叫喊。

sentences.english: Which platform is for the guangzhou special express, please?
sentences.chinese: 請問去廣州的特快車在哪個站臺上車？

sentences.english: When you climb the steps onto the bus, hold onto the handrails.
sentences.chinese: 當你上車時要抓住扶手。

sentences.english: When Ben-Hadad came out, Ahab had him come up into his chariot.
sentences.chinese: 便哈達出來見王，王就請他上車。

sentences.english: And he desired Philip that he would come up and sit with him.
sentences.chinese: 於是請腓利上車，與他同坐。

sentences.english: It is forbidden to bring fireworks on board trains during Spring Festival.
sentences.chinese: 春運期間，禁止挾帶煙花爆竹上車。

sentences.english: Excuse me. May I get by?
So he invited Philip to come up and sit with him.
sentences.chinese: 於是請腓利上車，與他同坐。

definition: to get off or out of (a bus, train, car etc)
to ride (in a car or carriage)/to drive/to motor
to pull up (stop one's vehicle)/to park/(of a machine) to stop working/to stall
to cross a barrier/to get through (an ordeal)/to pass (a test)/to reach (a standard)
car or other vehicle (bicycle, truck etc)
to enter the venue/to enter the arena/(aviation) to approach the airfield/(investing) to get into the market
